snippet: Judges note that symptoms associated with C.T.E. like mood swings and depression were widely prevalent in the general population and players who developed the conditions would not necessarily have C.T.E.
abstract: Federal appellate judges are skeptical about reversing lower-court ruling that excludes former pro football players who have not yet been diagnosed with chronic traumatic encephalopathy from class-action settlement with NFL.
lead_paragraph: Judges note that symptoms associated with C.T.E. like mood swings and depression were widely prevalent in the general population and players who developed the conditions would not necessarily have C.T.E.

headline.main: Judges Skeptical of Ex-N.F.L. Players’ Appeal Over Head Injury Settlement
headline.print_headline: Judges Skeptical of Retirees’ Settlement Appeal
